name: Skip
desc: Skip the next player's turn
detail: Skip the next player’s turn to avoid actions or penalties.

name: Reverse
desc: Reverse the play order
detail: Reverse the turn order and shake up the flow of the game.

name: Draw Attack
desc: Force a chosen player to draw 1 Vocabulary/Idiom card
detail: Force a chosen player to draw 1 Vocabulary/Idiom card and disrupt their strategy.

name: Double Trouble
desc: Attack two players in a row
detail: Target two players in a row using two Vocabulary/Idiom cards for double impact.

name: Wild Dare
desc: Pick one player to draw a Dare card
detail: Choose one player to draw a Dare card. Unpredictable fun awaits!

name: Shield
desc: Block any attack
detail: Block any attack or negative effect that targets you this turn.

name: Mirror
desc: Reflect the effect back
detail: Reflect the last card effect back to the player who used it.

name: Point Steal
desc: Steal 1 point from another player
detail: Steal 1 point from any opponent to get ahead in the game.

name: Point Block
desc: Prevent another player from gaining points
detail: Stop another player from earning points this turn.

name: Attack Cat
desc: Launch a bold move against others
detail: A Cat card without gameplay effect — perfect for combos or collection.

name: Chill Cat
desc: Stay cool and relaxed
detail: A peaceful Cat card — no special gameplay effect.

name: Confused Cat
desc: What’s going on?
detail: A fun Cat card that adds humor — no gameplay effect.

name: Joker Cat
desc: Wild and chaotic energy
detail: Despite its name, Joker Cat has no gameplay effect — used for combos or style.

name: Sleepy Cat
desc: Time to take a nap
detail: A sleepy Cat card with no effect — adds personality to the deck.

name: Book
desc: A thing you read.
example: I like reading a book before bed.

name: Cat
desc: A small animal that purrs.
example: My cat is very cute.

name: Friend
desc: Someone you like and trust.
example: Anna is my best friend.

name: Happy
desc: Feeling good or joyful.
example: She is always happy.

name: Mother
desc: Your female parent.
example: My mother cooks very well.

name: Run
desc: To move fast on your feet.
example: I run to school every day.

name: School
desc: A place to learn.
example: School starts at 7 AM.

name: Water
desc: A liquid we drink.
example: Drink water every day.

name: Cost an arm and a leg
desc: Something very expensive
detail: Used to describe something that costs a lot of money.
example: That designer bag cost an arm and a leg!

name: Bite the bullet
desc: Face a difficult situation bravely
detail: Used when someone decides to do something painful or unpleasant that they have been avoiding.
meaning: Can đảm đối mặt với điều khó khăn
example: I finally bit the bullet and went to the dentist.

name: Once in a blue moon
desc: Something that happens rarely
detail: Used to describe an event that happens very infrequently.
example: We go out for dinner once in a blue moon.

name: Break the ice
desc: Start a conversation or activity in a friendly way
detail: Used when someone makes people feel more relaxed in a social setting.
meaning: Phá vỡ sự ngại ngùng ban đầu
example: He told a joke to break the ice at the meeting.

name: Burn bridges
desc: Destroy relationships or opportunities permanently
detail: Used when someone ends relationships or connections in a way that makes it impossible to return.
meaning: Đốt cầu, cắt đứt mối quan hệ
example: Don’t burn bridges with your old boss—you might need a reference later!

name: Back to the drawing board
desc: Start over again after failure
detail: Used when a plan or idea fails and you must begin again from the start.
meaning: Làm lại từ đầu sau thất bại
example: Our design didn’t work, so it’s back to the drawing board.

name: Get cold feet
desc: Suddenly become nervous about something
detail: Used when someone loses confidence before doing something important.
meaning: Đột nhiên lo sợ, chùn bước
example: She got cold feet right before the wedding.

name: Hit the books
desc: Start studying hard
detail: Used when someone begins to study seriously for an exam or test.
example: I have a big test tomorrow, so I need to hit the books tonight.

name: Hit the nail on the head
desc: Be exactly right
detail: Used when someone says or does something that is exactly correct.
example: You really hit the nail on the head with that analysis.

name: Let the cat out of the bag
img: idiom/Let the cat out of the bag.jpg
desc: Reveal a secret by accident
detail: Used when someone accidentally tells a secret or surprise.
example: She let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party.

name: Burn the midnight oil
desc: Work late into the night
detail: Used when someone stays up very late to study or work.
meaning: Thức khuya làm việc, học tập
example: He’s been burning the midnight oil to finish his report.

name: On the ball
desc: Be alert and quick to react
detail: Used when someone is very prepared, attentive, and efficient.
example: The new manager is really on the ball.

name: A piece of cake
desc: Something very easy
detail: Used to describe a task that is simple to do.
example: That exam was a piece of cake.

name: Pull someone’s leg
desc: Tease or joke with someone
detail: Used when someone is kidding or joking with another person.
example: Relax, I’m just pulling your leg!

name: Sit on the fence
desc: Avoid making a decision
detail: Used when someone doesn’t take sides in a discussion or decision.
example: Stop sitting on the fence and choose a side.

name: Speak of the devil
desc: When someone appears right after being mentioned
detail: Used when the person you are talking about suddenly appears.
meaning: Nhắc Tào Tháo, Tào Tháo đến
example: Speak of the devil — there he is!

name: The ball is in your court
desc: It’s your turn to take action
detail: Used to tell someone it’s now their responsibility to make a decision or move.
example: I’ve done all I can. The ball is in your court now.

name: Throw in the towel
desc: Give up or quit
detail: Used when someone stops trying because they have accepted defeat.
example: After several failed attempts, he finally threw in the towel.

name: Kill two birds with one stone
desc: Achieve two things at once
detail: Used when one action accomplishes two different goals.
example: By studying on the train, she kills two birds with one stone.

name: Under the weather
desc: Feeling slightly ill
detail: Used when someone is not feeling well.
example: I’m feeling a bit under the weather today.

name: Advice
desc: An opinion or suggestion about what someone should do.
example: My teacher gave me good advice about studying abroad.

name: Challenge
desc: Something difficult that tests your skill or ability.
example: Learning a new language is a big challenge.

name: Communication
desc: The process of sharing information, ideas, or feelings.
example: Good communication is important in teamwork.

name: Improve
desc: To make something better.
example: She joined a course to improve her English skills.

name: Independent
desc: Able to do things without help from others.
example: Living alone helped him become more independent.

name: Opportunity
desc: A chance to do something or achieve something.
example: This job offers a great opportunity for growth.

name: Responsible
desc: Having the duty of taking care of something or someone.
example: You’re responsible for keeping your room clean.

name: Solution
desc: An answer to a problem or question.
example: We need to find a solution to this issue quickly.

name: Achievement
desc: Something you have successfully done or achieved, usually through effort.
example: Winning the competition was a great achievement for her team.

name: Consequence
desc: A result or effect of an action or situation.
example: Every choice you make has a consequence.

name: Evaluate
desc: To judge or assess the value or quality of something.
example: The teacher will evaluate your presentation skills.

name: Innovation
desc: A new idea, method, or invention.
example: Innovation is key to staying competitive in business.

name: Perspective
desc: A particular way of thinking about something or seeing a situation.
example: Try to see the situation from a different perspective.

name: Sustainable
desc: Able to continue over time without causing damage to the environment.
example: We must use more sustainable sources of energy.

name: Make Expression (Excited)
desc: Make a facial expression for the adjective “excited”.
detail: Use only your face to show “excited”. Whoever guesses correctly gets points.

name: Make Up a Word
desc: Make up an English word that sounds real and explain its meaning.
detail: Invent a believable English-sounding word and define it in your own words. (Just kidding—have fun!)

name: Illustrate with a Gesture
desc: Make a gesture to illustrate a vocabulary word.
detail: Act out any vocabulary word using gestures only. No speaking.

name: Pose the Animal
desc: Pose your body to describe an animal — others guess what it is.
detail: Use body language to imitate an animal. First correct guess earns points.

name: Quick Read & Spell
desc: Quickly read an English word and spell it — points are deducted for mistakes.
detail: Draw a word, read it aloud fast, then spell it. Each mistake = −1 point.

name: Antonym of “Designated”
desc: Say an English word that is the opposite of the word “designated”.
detail: Give a correct antonym for “designated”.

name: Last Letter of Your Name (A)
desc: Say an English word that starts with the last letter of your name.
detail: Think quickly and say any valid English word beginning with your name’s last letter.

name: Antonym of “Hot” (A)
desc: Say an English word that is the opposite of “hot”.
detail: Provide a correct antonym for “hot”.

name: Last Letter of Your Name (B)
desc: Say an English word that starts with the last letter of your name.
detail: Same challenge, new card variant.

name: Antonym of “Hot” (B)
desc: Say an English word that is the opposite of “hot”.
detail: Same challenge, new card variant.

name: Sentence with a Color
desc: Say an English sentence that contains any color.
detail: Create any natural sentence that includes a color word (red, blue, green, etc.).

name: Alphabet Singing
desc: Sing any English sentence starting with a letter from A–Z.
detail: Pick a random letter and sing a sentence beginning with that letter.
